title: Meet the AV Guy

Attention Swancon panelists, this session has been allotted for you to come and check out the standard A/V setup of your panel room. Should you require to test your devices, now is the time! Your friendly A/V Guy, Andy Hahn, will be available to chat to if you have any questions or requests.

title: Lockpicking Workshop
tags: workshop
description:
PickPals presents a hands on guide to lockpicking.
Picks and locks will be provided, come and learn. There will be a competition with prized at the end of the workshop.
We encourage lock picking (only) as a sport, it is completely legal to sell and carry lock picks in WA.

title: Hammer Horror: Frankenstein Saga.
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Horror,  presentation, Loud

title: Unexpected Cthulu. the mythos outside the Lovecraft
tags: ExportMe,  Horror,  Needs Moderator,  panel, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Dave Cake, Daniel Drhoz, Keira McKenzie
description:
I was walking down the street oneday, and then suddenly. *Cthulu*.
Cthulu isn't a monster, Cthulu is a brand. Discussion of the reuse of Eldritch concepts and styles. And of the other works that contribute to the cthulu mythos and the subgenre in general. Some argue the best cthulu mythos works are not by lovecraft at all.

title: Secure Containment Protocols
tags: ExportMe,  Horror,  Needs Moderator,  Needs Panelists,  panel
description:
SCP is a collaborative fiction wiki.
Documenting secure containment protocols for monsters (and other issues), described on the site.
We;re going to talk about some of our faverates and maybe even write a few together.

title: Time Lord in exile: Doctor Who's original 9th season
tags: ExportMe,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Scifi, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee, Danny Oz, Colin Sharpe
description:
Jon Pertwee Season Nine- Travel back  into the TARDIS and  Classic Monsters  & villain returns this season we see the return of the Daleks, Ice Warriors, and the Master.
This season The Doctor and Jo encounter  the Daleks that control future Earth, Ice Warriors at the court of Peladon, meeting the Sea-Devils.
And seeing The Master watching the Clangers as alien species.

title: Science Doesn't Work That Way
tags: ExportMe,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Scifi, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Daniel Drhoz, Stuart Finlay, Natasha Hurley-Walker
description:
Sure it is common to see scientific screwups in individual showed. Sinking Ice.
But some scientific falsehoods are pervasive and are genre defining.
We are talking Quantum Entanglement for faster-than-light communication. We are talking radiation caused mutation.

title: 1960's Anime never come to the West.
tags: Anime,  Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  presentation, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
description: 1960's Anime that never made it to the West- with the success with Astroboy, Japanese TV was awash different kinds of anime, which never made it to the west, for many were very culture and the humour was too hard to translate and other made in b/w, and big market US was not interested because of colour. This Video Presentation take small look what we had missed.

title: We've watched a lot of anime so you don't have to
tags: Anime,  Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  presentation, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
description: We share the recent gems in the flood of anime available. Make it easy for people not as anime obsessed, or who fell out of anime watching awhile ago and don't know where to come back, to work out what to watch.

Should we own chickens?

Should we build chicken bunkers?

title: Reimagining Monsters as Protagonists
tags: ExportMe,  Fantasy,  Needs Moderator,  panel, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Prema Arasu, Sally Beasley, Cathy Cupitt, Jane Espenson, Leonard Goulds
description:
iZombie and Warm Bodies have sympathetic zombie. We had Twilight, with vampires. More historically we had Frankenstein. Prior to modern fantasy even wizards and witches were terrifying monsters. Onyx Path / Whitewolf publishes multiple roleplaying systems dedicated to playing as monsters.

Moderator Cathy Cupitt

title: Star Trek -- 50th Anniversary Panel
tags: ExportMe,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Scifi, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Michael Cogan, Damian Magee, Danny Oz
description: In 1966, came Sci-Fi TV show would define sci-fi and social issues, join as our panelist recall how they were introduce to show, fond memories and what was the best worst episodes.

tags: AdultsOnly,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Scifi, ExportMe

None of this Technobable. Hackers done right.
Hear the praise of shows that do well.
Hear the surprisingly course language towards shows that get it wrong

title: Is Spy-Fic Speculative Fiction?
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  panel,  Scifi, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Jack Bridges, Christopher Courtis, Frames White
description:
Obviously we have SF spy-fic - Charles Stross's Laundry Series, Person of Interest.
But is all spy fiction it intrinsically speculative anyway?
We'll be talking about both.

title: Fans and substance (ab)use
tags: ExportMe,  Fandom/Conrunning,  Needs Moderator,  panel, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Jack Bridges, Chris Coman, Samara Morgan, Ian Nichols
description:
Altering our minds with chemicals.
Its seems like fandom and (legal or otherwise) substance use go together, like Gin and Tonic. Whether it is discussion over coffee, or a room party at a convention. Fandom also has higher visibility for prescription medications for mental health (Not that that is hard, given it is almost invisible in the wider community)
In an effort to reduce stigma and encourage safety, this panel is not adults only, but may parental discretion is advised.

Moderator: Ian Nichols

tags: discussion,  Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  Gaming,  Round table, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
description:
Writing a Campaign isn't hard.
We are going to do it together, in 1 hour.

title: Steam for Booksellers
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Fandom/Conrunning,  Round table, Does Not Need Moderator
description:
What would we like from an online bookseller.
Steam has largely defeated online game piracy by being simply more convenient. Its accessible on all devises, generally trusted, and with almost all content desired.
Few (if any) online ebooks sellers can say the same thing. 
Moderator: Sally Beasley

title: How isolation has affected our local fandom
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Fandom/Conrunning, Round table
description:
Perth is very isolated, it is not so easy here to go and interact with fans elsewhere. Often expos and tours skip us. How has that changed how we are?
Moderator: Sally Beasley

title: I like this Group / Con / Event so much ...
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  Gaming,  Needs Panelists, Lightning (series of 3 minute), Round table

Clubs, Events, Cons, Meetups, Locations, etc. 
General discussion about geekdom events.
This is the Event/Con etc spruking session. It is suggested that if you want your organization etc spruked then this is the time and the place to do it. 
Come in, and add your name to the list of speakers.
Moderator: Daniel Ryba

title: How to Sort your Library
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Written Fiction, Round table

Alphabetically? By size? What do you do with series with multiple authors?

Runequest is one of the defining RPGs.

description: Won't somebody think of the children! When characters "settle down" they don't have to settle down. A discussion of protagonists who have responsibilities.

title: Best Horror Films of 2015
tags: ExportMe,  Horror,  Loud,  Needs Moderator,  presentation, AdultsOnly
description:
What was successful, what innovated, what worked,  and why it worked.
(A reverse horror trailer park, looking backwards: will include clips)

title: The Dead Are Coming: Surviving the Zombie Outbreak
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Horror,  Needs Moderator, Round table
description:
Zombie stories continue to be popular in film and television, and most viewers are familiar with how the zombie apocalypse usually happens. Is that really how it would happen in a real-life situation â?? assuming for the moment, of course, that zombies could be real? How would society react to the walking dead? What would our governmentsâ?? responses be? What would a post-zombie world really look like, and what things do the writers of zombie narratives always seem to forget?
Moderator: Samara

title: The Swancon Screenings of 2015
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  panel,  TV/Movies, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters

description: So many problems with a "bad" game can be trance back to the very start -- character generation and the first session -- or even the choice of players and system. How can you make sure all your new games are good ones?

people: Tash Maitland, Damon Ross, Daniel Ryba
description: Playing in Starwars, Mistborn, Amber. Some story settings have systems written for them. Other times you can do it yourself. Some worlds are boring if you are not the main characters from the books. The does, the don't, and the never should have dones.

title: GMing Workshop: Horror
tags: discussion,  ExportMe,  Gaming,  Needs Moderator, Round table
people: Roland Kerr, Michael O'Brien, Daniel Ryba
description:
There are plenty of horror RPGs out there, but how can you actually play them and feel fear? How can you prevent it from becoming action or comedy? Should you?
This is a interactive, round table workshop. Come, Share, Learn.

tags: Creative Works,  Needs Moderator,  panel, ExportMe

How interacting with fans, and the great flow of information of the modern age shapes your works.

description:
Being an author in Perth, trying to reach the outside world is a major challenge, with decidedly mixed results, and lots of frustrations, would be good.  We each have had greatly difffering experiences, but have all faced the same challenges, with differing results.

Moderator: Shona Husk

title: Sing-along with Cylons
tags: Fandom/Conrunning,  Fantasy,  Loud,  Scifi,  TV/Movies, Multimedia
description:
The Geek Singalong returns for 2016! Fear me! 
People like to sing
People like to sing silly songs even more

title: Hitch Hikers Guide to Swancon
tags: a launch in five parts
people: PRK , Naomi Butcher, Michael Cogan, Chris Coman, Kim Fenwick, Owen Godfrey, Brian Johnson, Damian Magee
description:
#ALaunchInFiveParts - This is the story of that terrible stupid Contastrophe and some of its Consequences. It’s also the story of a Con Book, a Con Book called The Hitch Hiker’s Guide to Swancon.

A series of short "from book" performances, and a welcome to Swancon, for new and old members alike. Come along and get your Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster On.

title: Dinner, (including the Pizza Restaurant at the End of the Universe)
tags: a launch in five parts, Break
people: Naomi Butcher, Michael Cogan, Chris Coman, Kim Fenwick, Owen Godfrey, Brian Johnson, Damian Magee
description:
#ALaunchInFiveParts - There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizzare and inexplicable.
There is another theory which states that this has already happened.
Runs over Dinner Break: Come with us down the hill to Langley Park for a Pizza Dinner and more short "from book" performances. Get some early teasers and clues about Swancon 42's official Launch on Saturday. 
***Please Pre-Order your Pizza Preference using the Form available in your Con Bag or at the Front Desk ($5 Payment at the Park).***

title: Launch: Life, The Universe, And Everything
tags: a launch in five parts
people: PRK , Naomi Butcher, Michael Cogan, Chris Coman, Kim Fenwick, Owen Godfrey, Brian Johnson, Damian Magee
description:
#ALaunchInFiveParts - O people who wait in the shadow of Deep Thought! Honoured Descendants of Vroomfondel and Majikthise, the Greatest and Most Truly Interesting Pundits the Universe has even known… The Time of Waiting is over!

If you attend just one 2017 Launch event from #ALaunchInFiveParts, make it this one. To you, at this time, will be revealed the Ultimate Answer to the Great Question of Life, the Universe and Everything. (Spoiler: It's Swancon 42) 

More importantly, you can find out all the details of the Guests, Venue, Pricing and more, along with being entertained by more "from book" performances, and buy your 2017 Launch Priced Memberships!

title: Book Launch: Emperor of the Eight Islands
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  Fantasy,  panel, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
description: Celebrate the release of Lian Hearn's fantastic new novel: Emperor of the Eight Islands. The first book in her new The Tale of Shikanoko series.

title: 30 years of Lois McMaster Bujold
tags: ExportMe,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Scifi, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Sally Beasley, Chris Coman, Anna Hepworth, Heather Magee
description: From Shards of Honor,in 1986, to the latest book Gentleman Jole and the Red Queen, released just last month. We look back over the last 30 years of her writing and career, which has included winning 5 Hugos.

title: Primer on The Legion of Superheroes
tags: Comics,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  panel, Does Not Need Moderator
description:
The LSH What is it? Who are all these folks? And just how do you get started on nearly 60 years of comics history without being overwhelmed?
Moderator: Stevo

title: Why You should run Swancon 2018
tags: discussion,  Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Fandom/Conrunning, Round table
description:
Running a Swancon is a good idea.
Recently we have had very few (read no) bids to run.
Why you should not be scared to bid, and the great fun running swancon can be,
Ideally the outcome of this discussion is a skeleton of two competing bids

title: I love this video games so much I'm going to talk about it for 3 minutes
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  ExportMe,  panel,  Video Games, Lightning (series of 3 minute)
description:
Talk for 3 minutes about a great game. Convince us to play it.
 Feel free to add yourself to the list of speakers on the day
Moderator: Evan Beasley

title: Young Adult at Heart
tags: Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Written Fiction, ExportMe
people: Anna Hepworth, Laura Hodge, Rebecca Laffar-Smith, Susanna Rogers
description: Why adults still love to read young adult works.

title: Homework: So long and thanks for all the fish
tags: Round table, a launch in five parts
people: PRK , Naomi Butcher, Michael Cogan, Chris Coman, Kim Fenwick, Owen Godfrey, Brian Johnson, Damian Magee
description:
#ALaunchInFiveParts - She finally knew how the world could be made a good and happy place. This time it was right, it would work, and no one would have to get nailed to anything. This is her story.
And it's the story of what great books you should be reading this year to get ready for Swancon 42. 
It's also a double-backward somersault through a hoop while whistling the "Star Spangled Banner," that was, in fact, a message. The message was "So long, and thanks for all the fish."

title: Is Online Fan Fiction a Community?
tags: Needs Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: Can online fan fiction be understood as a community? If so what parameters exist that make this space a community space? Is it important for online fan fiction to be a community? Does it matter that online fan fiction is, or is not a community? If online fan fiction is not a community how else can this collective of people be characterised and described? Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Eusociality
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation,  Science and Tech, Academic
description: Social Insects are one of the most successful experiments produced by the already wildly successful Insect class. Come and learn more about the ants, bees, and wasps, and the other eusocial animals.

title: My Dog Has No Nose. Or Bones. Or Skin.
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation,  Science and Tech, Academic
description: Drhoz has regularly horrified Swancon attendees with tales of parasites and gruesome diseases. Now he's going to kick it up a notch with contagious cancers.

title: Visualising Gender Fluidity
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: Existing visual models of gender are static, focused on rigid categories, and don't capture the fluidity of the lived experience of identity. Using research into the current models used within gender variant communities, we designed an animated model of gender performance and identity for use with university staff wishing to be part of the ALLY Program. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Personas - A tool for increasing diversity in SF
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: the National Centre for Student Equity in Higher Education developed a suite of personas to represent students from disadvantaged backgrounds. They were designed to be used as a tool for solving complex resourcing and policy issues, based on real demographic information and interconnected issues that real students engage with, without exposing confidential student data.   Investigate how these personas could also be used by writers as a tool for character development, and including nuanced characters from diverse and/or imagined backgrounds in their work. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Theory and practice - How theory can be used to create imagined communities
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: In the academic world, theory and practice often seem to be two separate things. However, theory can inform practice by raising new possibilities that might otherwise not be considered. How can theoretical models can be used to explain and predict human behaviour in the context of student equity, and how could they be used to create similar models of behaviour for fictional civilizations? Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: A Change in the Weather - How New is Cli-Fi and is it Science Fiction?
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: Is the new genre of climate change fiction, Cli-Fi science fiction or not and does it matter? Anthropogenic climate change is real and dangerous and, if left unchecked, is capable of rendering the Earth uninhabitable.  Young adult dystopian literature has been gaining traction since September 11, 2001, peaking with Suzanne Collins's successful Hunger Games trilogy and films. This paper will outline the ways in which science fiction has been exploring realistic ecocatastrophe scenarios for decades in tandem with social and political movements and concerns. It I will suggest that Cli-Fi is being used as a method of artificially distancing fiction classified as "literary" from perceived genre taint and will conclude that such quarantining procedures are more than just unnecessary; they may be potentially harmful. For all of us! Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Retrospective on a lifetime in SF fandom as a cultural curator
tags: Does Not Need Moderator, Academic
description: That's a bit of a w**ky title, says Grant. Still he said he would do his best to make a presentation out of it. Whether or not he likes it, Grant is seen as the  "teller of tales" and the long memory of the SF community.

title: Let's talk about boobs, baby.
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  Half (15-25 minutes),  presentation, Academic
description: A rambling discussion of the biology and chemistry of human lactaion, not limited to looking at cells in human milk, gene expression, micro RNA and other funky things. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Encoded- genetics and DNA realities
tags: Needs Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: DNA is the stuff of life and the double helix generates a code that represents every gene in our body. The questions of mutation, recoding, manipulation and evolution are often represented in science fiction but how much of this is possible within the realms of current technologies and techniques and how much is purely in the realm of fiction? Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Undead dilemmas
tags: AdultsOnly,  Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: Death comes! What happens to a body after death? Fiction has a history of reanimation, vampires, zombies, ghouls and Frankenstein's monster. The human body isn't designed to continue beyond expiration so what environmental challenges would these fictional beings have to contend with? What affects Australian corpses in particular? Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Big Weather: Predicting a future climate
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  panel, Academic
people: Jack Bridges, Chris Creagh, Cat Sparks
description: Within the next century runaway climate change will radically change the nature of the planet Earth. Temperatures will increase, oceans will acidify, sea levels will rise, cities will flood and food and water supplies will diminish. What will the Earth of 2115 look like? What effects will it have on speculative fiction attempting to accurately portray the future? A panel of specialists explore the very grave risks that humanity faces â?? and suggest ways in which human civilizations may evolve and adjust in the coming decades. Can SF authors find a way through the chaos even if governments can not. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: User's Guide to Time Travel
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  presentation, Academic
description: Suppose you travel into the past. In a fit of homicidal rage, you attempt to kill your grandfather before he conceived your mother. Suppose you succeed, and your grandfather dies at your hand. Then you will never be born and you will never travel back in time to kill your grandfather. So your grandfather both lives and dies. Paradox! Suppose, instead you fail. Why do you fail? What is it that stops you from taking your grandfatherâ??s life? If one is unable to kill oneâ??s grandfather, do the paradoxes of time travel therefore threaten oneâ??s free will? Can the paradoxes be avoided by introducing higher temporal dimensions in which grandfathers can be freely killed without consequence? And are we forced to posit a mysterious â??logical guardianâ??, hell bent on ironing out paradoxes wherever they arise? This talk will take you on a multi-dimensional tour of philosophy and time. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Crime Fighting Flies
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  Half (15-25 minutes),  presentation, Academic
description: How the great Australian pest is an important resource in crime investigation. The first documented use of entomology (the study of insects) in a forensic setting was in China in the 13th century, when farmers were instructed to lay down their scythes, revealing a murderer by the attraction of flies to their bloodied blade. In the last few decades forensic entomology has developed into an important tool in crime scene analysis.  Applications range from the determination of the time since death to detecting the movement of the body, to an analysis of chemicals in a body.  Forensic entomology is also applied in cases of food contamination, and in animal or human abuse or neglect situations.  Our pesky fellow Aussies can be more helpful than hindrance. Full abstract is online at https://2016.swancon.com.au/content/academic

title: Ch-ch-ch-changeling - The Many Faces of Bowie
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  ExportMe,  Multimedia,  presentation, Loud
description: David Bowie died earlier this year. During his life Bowie was relentlessly creative, working in music, film and other media in a career spanning almost 50 years. Invented characters like Ziggy Stardust have played a fascinating role in Bowie's output, as he told their stories through concept albums and portrayed them in music videos. Take a brief chronological tour through Bowie's musical career, with a focus on some of the wonderful masks that were worn by this ever-changing artist.

title: YouTube Channel Suggests - Entertainment
tags: Art,  Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  Loud,  presentation, ExportMe
description: Name the one thing we all know that YouTube is used for, that right, cat videos but there is so much more out there when it comes to entertainment on the platform. Come along and find out about some of the channels that can supply you with endless hours entertainment.

title: YouTube Channel Suggests - Educational
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  Loud,  presentation,  Science and Tech, ExportMe
description: One of the more recent educational tools to have entered our lives is YouTube; there are literally hundreds of channels that are dedicated to teaching us about nearly every single thing out there. With so many, which can you trust, which are entertaining and which teach us the all things that we want to know. Come along to find out a bunch of channels that I think might serve you well.

title: Z-Z-Z-Zenith
tags: Comics,  Needs Moderator,  panel, ExportMe
people: Kitty Byrne, Dave Cake, John Parker
description:
Or Grant Morrison's most insane superhero story (And that's saying something!)
In 1987 no-one expected 2000ad's first serious superhero to come out of the gates quite like it did. A rock star lead hero (Literally signed up by Stock Aitken and Waterman) fighting Cthuloid Ubermench leftovers from perverse Nazi Science, Evil versions of Richard Branson and horrors from beyond the stars (Or are they?)  aided by people like a super powered Tory MP and an Aceeed fuelled Robot riding a technicoloured Dinosaur!

title: Dr Watson  as a Woman
tags: Needs Moderator,  panel,  TV/Movies, ExportMe
description: At Last  a woman portrayed the great Doctor Watson, why did take so long, has producers of Elementary  achieved their aim? This panel take look at history why took long for audience  acceptance of a woman, quickly examine first actress to Watson until now, from Joanne Woodward to Lucy Liu.

title: NonViolent Video Games
tags: ExportMe,  Needs Moderator,  panel,  Video Games, Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters
people: Sophie Ambrose, Kitty Byrne, Danica Zuks
description: Violence in video games can be great, but it can also feel inescapable. What are some ways video games can remain entertaining without relying on violence at all, or at least not as much? And what are our favourite examples of games which have eschewed or explored violence in cool and interesting ways?

title: How Should Comics Be Written for Women
tags: Comics,  Does Not Need More Panellists/Presenters,  Needs Moderator,  panel, ExportMe
people: Kitty Byrne, Lily Eivers, Candice Schilder, Danica Zuks
description: And about time too: Making comics for women. It seems silly that comics haven't tried harder to capture the female market, considering that they make up 50% of the population of the planet. Marvel's definitely trying to up their game, with a renewed focus on female superheroes like Captain Marvel, Ms Marvel, Thor and Silk - but is that just falling into the same trap as before, assuming that readers only want to read about characters of their own gender. This panel will discuss other ways that the comic industry could diversify in order to cater to the ignored part of their audience - and probably wind up appealing to more people as a whole.

title: Designing Mechanics and Fluff
tags: Gaming,  Needs Moderator,  panel, ExportMe
people: Michael O'Brien, Damon Ross, Anthony Sweet
description:
Should your write the fluff and design the mechanics after?
Or the reverse? Must both be done at the same time?
A look at this question in the context of RPGs and Boardgames.

Lets brainstorm.

description: In the realworld being LBGTQIA, is not unusual; but for characters in most media it is. We are talking about characters not being special because of their sexuality, or gender-identity; but being mundane, expected, statistically representative.

This is a pretty exciting book, and will be release mid-2016.
After about half an hour of readings, we will move into a round-table discussion of about disabled characters in post-apocalyptic settings in general.

Moderator: Susan Ackermann

This presentation will be streamed live from the Natcon in Brisbane.

This presentation will be streamed live from the NatCon in Brisane.

title: Mariokart WiiU
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Play as iconic Nintendo characters racing to win trohpies and gain fame. Race across a variety of courses from various Nintendo franchises. This will be run as a tournament. Now with all DLC content!!!

title: Super Smash Bros WiiU/ 3DS
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Play as various Nintendo characters from all sorts of Nintendo games. Watch them beat each other up in a frantic fighting game for up to 8 players at the same time! This will be run as a tournament. Now with all DLC characters, stages and content!

title: Halo Marathon
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Come enlist as a Spartan in the UNSC! Compete against other Spartans for glory and points to be the beat...and once you've survived that, we'll throw you into a bunch of crazy alternative games such as Demolition Derby, Run to survive, Super Happy Fun Land and Left 4 Dead! This will be run as a tournament.

title: Open console gaming
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Come play some consoles! Try new games, play with friends or catch up on a game you haven't finished yet.

title: Blur
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Do you like cars? Do you like Mario kart? Why not combine real cars with the mechanics of Mario kart?! Well here it is! Blur is a racing game with items and power ups where you blow each other up while trying to reach the finish line.

title: DS Fun-o-rama!
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Bring your DS, 3DS or 2DS for some group gaming fun with other hand held console gaming players. We'll be playing Mario kart DS or 7, Pokemon, etc. Chargers will be available if you're low on battery!

title: Soul Calibur 4 & 5
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: People beating each other up with swords, guns...a giant hammer...that squeeks...yep! Soul Calibur in a nutshell and we'll be playing the 4th and 5th generation of the game. This will be run as a tournament.

title: 4 player co-op bananza
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Get a group of you and 3 friends together and come join us in playing all sorts of 4 player co-op games! To name a few; castle crashers, scott pilgram vs. The world, nuke tanks, Ratchet and clank all 4 one, marvel ultimate alliance, etc.

title: Left 4 Dead 1 & 2 Survival endurance marathon
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Play as a surviver of the zombie apocolypse with 3 friends trying to reach a safe haven. Your goal is to play through every stage and survive it all! We'll be nice to you...I promise...

title: Open console gaming
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Come play some consoles! Try new games, play with friends or catch up on a game you haven't finished yet.

title: Retro gaming Morning!
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Miss the old days of console gaming? Well now you can come relive the era of the old classics because all the consoles will be changed over for Retro ones! Come play on the Super Nintendo, N64, Play station 1, Sega mega drive and other old school gaming platforms!

title: Portal 2 Co-op!
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Play as two robots trying to survive the testing set by GLaDOS at Aperture science! Can you and a friend survive the tests?!

title: Spyro co-op!
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: Play as Spyro and Cynder on their adventures to save the kingdom of dragons! Can you save the world?

title: Griff Ball!
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: The great sport of taking a land mine, running to the goal and then blowing your self up! Doesn't get much better than that! Play in teams of 4 against other teams of 4 and become the best team ever! Making up of funny team names is manditory and this game will be run as a tournament!

title: Open Console gaming
tags: Does Not Need Moderator,  interactive, Video Games
description: This is your last chance to come and play some console games at the convention! So come on down and have some fun before we pack up everything!
